name: UpdatePaymentType
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `PaymentTypes:Edit`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

C.name: BlockOverPayments
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: CanBeCancelled
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: CanBeRefunded
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: CanBeUsedForPayments
C.description:
Setting this to false results in refund only, will therefor only work with CanBeRefunded:true and CanRefundWithoutOriginalPaymentTransaction:true

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: CanRefundWithoutOriginalPaymentTransaction
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

This is the ID of a `GiftCardConfiguration`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

This is the ID of a `LoyaltyProgram`

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: PinHandler
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RefundPending
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiredFunctionality
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiredFunctionalityScope
C.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Create
* `2` - Edit
* `4` - Delete
* `8` - View
* `31` - Manage
* `32` - Settings
* `64` - Scripting
* `127` - All

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiredUserType
C.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Employee
* `2` - Customer
* `4` - Anonymous
* `8` - Business
* `17` - System
* `64` - Debtor
* `256` - LimitedTrust
* `512` - Tester
* `1024` - RemovedByRequest
* `2048` - Api
* `4096` - Impersonated

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiresAmount
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiresConfirmationForPayments
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiresConfirmationForRefunds
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: RequiresInteractionForRefunds
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

D.name: RoleID
D.description: This is the ID of a `Role`

B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: CashJournalMethod
B.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Close
* `2` - OpenAndClose
* `3` - Ignore

B.name: Category
B.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - Other
* `1` - Debit
* `2` - Credit
* `3` - Cash
* `4` - Voucher
* `5` - Online
* `6` - Rounding
* `7` - Exchange

B.name: Code
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.description: This is the ID of a `PaymentType`

F.name: Code
F.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

F.name: Message
F.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

F.name: RequestID
F.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

F.name: Type
F.description: A short description of the error type.

G.name: ExternalIDs
G.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

G.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
G.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

G.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
G.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
